area_name: West Wall Outer (Buckets to Burbank Area)

content.description:
Start about 30' right of Buckets To Burbank and make bouldery moves to reach a horizontal (medium piece). Easy moves lead upward to another horizontal (med/large piece) where a highstep takes you over a small roof/overlap to reach a bolt below the top. Friction moves past the bolt lead somewhat up and right to finish and lead to anchors on a ledge.

Good climbing that's similar to the other routes on the wall, although not quite as high quality as the others.
content.protection: Bolt (3/8"), gear to 3 inches, bolted anchor
content.location: This route is located on the same wall as Buckets To Burbank and Ledges To Lawndale, near the right end.

climbs.name: Ledges to Lawndale
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Dan Wirth, March 1985

content.description: On the left side of the face look for two bolts high up, then draw an imaginary line straight down from the first bolt to the ground to figure where the route starts. Climb steep overhanging buckets (with great holds) to a horizontal crack and then follow the bolt line past a second horizontal to the top. This route is to the left of Buckets to Burbank.
content.protection: 2 bolts, small nuts/cams in first horizontal crack, bolted anchor

climbs.name: La Bella Katchina
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Derek Reinig

content.description: Cool OW crack behind the Buckets to Burbank Wall. Faces same way as Buckets to Burbank Wall.
content.location: Canyon just behind B to B Wall.

climbs.name: Knob Cheese
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, George Armstrong, Chris Lyons

content.description: 4 Bolt face to a finger crack.
content.location: On the backside of Buckets to Burbank Wall.  (Across from La Belle Katchina).

content.description:
While short, this route offers a relaxing and variable line up the West face of the west Hall of Horrors wall. It is just left of Ledges to Lawndale on the highly featured wall, and offers a great view of King Dome and the expansive valley. The climbing is on a jigsaw puzzle of patina cracks allowing for creativity in placing pro and in choosing a line up the route.

Walk off to the north with easy scrambling.
content.protection: Wires and a few small to mid-size cams is more than enough. For the anchor there is a single bolt which can be backed up with a hex or large cam.

content.description:
This route starts right of Pullups to Pasadena by about 10-15'.  There is a pretty obvious jug above an arch that is the target of the first few moves.  The start is on some thin face with a few edges, and there is a good size sidepull up and to the left.

It's a crux start to use the sidepull, gain the jug, and then continue a move or two up and left to two small horns, then a balancy stand.  It's pretty moderate (5.9-5.8) until the topout which is a little dicey on thin slab.

I'll post a picture of the route when I can.  The FA (as far as I know) was in 11/2004 by Travis Chamberlain and Louie Lebron, after a hefty amount of beer (Rolling Rock) the night before, hence the name.
content.protection:
You might be able to lead Hanging Hungover on gear, but it would be pretty runout between the horizontal cracks (like many of the climbs on this face).

It is better to use the TR anchors for Pullups to Pasadena

climbs.name: Buckets to Burbank
climbs.fa: Matt Cox, Dave Evans & Darrell Hensel, November 1975

content.description:
Start just right of

Ledges to Lawndale

and take the easiest path through the initial steep section - it's possible to climb direct at about 5.10.

Once established in the first horizontal move up and right aiming for the solitary bolt. Clip the bolt, pass another horizontal and make easy moves on positive patina edges. The last few moves are heady and involve leaving the security of a small ledge to do a short bit of smearing to the top.

Bolted anchor on top as well as a natural thread which can be used and backed up with small gear if bolts are missing.

A very good route with an interesting mix of steep positive climbing and insecure friction.
content.protection:
1 bolt, 2 bolt anchor (all 3/8")

gear to 2.5 inches
content.location:
You'll find this route, the original on the wall, on the backside of the wall with Jane's Addiction and right of the route

Ledges to Lawndale

.

pathTokens: West Wall Outer (Buckets to Burbank Area)
